critique: The document expresses strong disapproval and concern regarding the actions of the South African government. The president conveys a sense of disgust and anger towards the described policies and actions, particularly the Expropriation Act and discriminatory practices. There is also an element of sadness and concern for the Afrikaner population affected by these policies, as well as surprise at the actions taken by South Africa. The document aims to evoke similar emotions in the American public, emphasizing the injustice and potential threat to national interests.
